banner.heading: Your Strategic Partner in Building Research and Innovation Ecosystems
banner.desc: Knowledgex builds ventures from research, turns industry challenges into academic opportunities, and runs high-impact research projects. We help organizations innovate by developing custom innovation methodologies, building innovation hubs, and operating deep and tough tech accelerators.

ourWhy.title: Our Why
ourWhy.subtitle: From Knowledge to Business
ourWhy.desc: Our purpose is to bridge the gap between academic excellence and commercial relevance by building innovation ecosystems that empower research institutions, corporates, and emerging ventures to transform knowledge into market-ready solutions.

impactBanner.title: Innovate with Purpose

kofactor.title: What is KoFactor?
kofactor.description: An innovation enablement program that transforms research and scientific ideas into practical, market-ready solutions. It provides a structured journey helping participants develop early-stage concepts into commercially viable products, supported by expert mentors and hands-on workshops. The program focuses on fostering entrepreneurial thinking among researchers and innovators. It offers a collaborative environment connecting academia and industry. It serves as a platform to test and accelerate scientific ideas into scalable and sustainable business models.

objectives.title: Program Objectives
objectives.downloads: Transform scientific research into real-world impact
objectives.clients: Develop early-stage prototypes ready for testing
objectives.sessions: Design innovative and scalable business models
objectives.users: Bridge the gap between innovation and commercialization
objectives.files: Guide ideas toward market-ready products and solutions

footer.subscribe: So, if you are industry innovator or a corporate innovation leader passionate about R&I projects.

uvera.description: What sets our technology apart is its remarkable efficiency, achieving these shelf life improvements in just 30 seconds, and all without the need for any chemical additives.

1.title: Rasid – KoFactor Journey
1.description: Rasid began in March 2025 as a collaboration between a research-driven team with a vision, and a technical team capable of transforming that vision into a working solution. From day one, we focused on understanding the problem deeply: how to track infectious diseases with precision and how to empower early intervention. Through brainstorming, we explored existing solutions, identified their limitations, and defined how Rasid could go beyond. As part of KoFactor, the technical team took the lead in extracting product requirements, analyzing current solutions, and understanding user experience challenges. We learned how to shape an MVP (Minimum Viable Product) that’s compelling to both investors and users. We built early UI/UX prototypes based on real user flows and incorporated Saudi platform design guidelines for consistency and trust. We received mentorship from industry pioneers, refined our direction, and successfully developed the first version of Rasid’s MVP. Despite challenges in data sourcing, system design, and cross-functional coordination, we stayed committed. Today, Rasid is on the verge of building strategic partnerships and preparing for a wide-scale launch. Our ambition remains high—to become the go-to platform for infection tracking and public health support.

2.title: MAX – Transforming Surgery
2.description: MAX is an advanced medical visualization solution revolutionizing how surgeries are conducted in hospitals...

3.title: Foreseen – AI in E-Commerce
3.description: Foreseen started from an idea first envisioned in 2022 by Dr. Ahmed and Salman Bett — to help e-commerce stores make smarter inventory decisions through demand forecasting. We officially joined CoFactor on January 24, 2025, and that support gave us the clarity and structure we needed to move fast. Just a couple of weeks later, on February 9, we interviewed dozens of merchants and gained deep insights into their real pain points. By March 1, we began developing our prototype. In April, we completed full market research across the MENA region. In May, we started building our core forecasting engine and pipeline. Recently, we finalized our first pitch deck and submitted Foreseen for Salla integration, which is currently under review. Thanks to KoFactor, we moved from scattered ideas to a focused, working product — and we’re just getting started.
